newsitem.title: LEBANON: Pro-Israeli militia official killed in Lebanon bomb.
newsitem.headline: Pro-Israeli militia official killed in Lebanon bomb.

text.p: A security official of Israel's client South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia was killed on Saturday when a bomb believed planted by guerrillas exploded near his house, SLA sources said.
The sources said Kameel Nimr was killed instantly when the bomb went off near his home in the village of Aishiyeh just inside a border zone that Israel occupies in south Lebanon.
"The bomb exploded as Nimr went out of his house and was heading to his car. He was killed immediately and the blast caused some damage to the house," one source said.
It was not immediately known who was behind the blast. Pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) guerrillas have in the past killed a number of SLA officials in similar bomb attacks in the buffer strip.
It was the first SLA fatality in south Lebanon this year.

Six SLA members were wounded in attacks since January 1 against 19 killed by guerrillas in 1996, mainly in roadside bombings against their patrols or in coordinated raids on their posts or patrols using mortar bombs, rockets or machineguns.
Six Israeli soldiers have been killed in similar attacks in the south this year against 27 killed last year.

Hizbollah leads an Islamic Resistance to oust some 1,000 Israeli troops and the 3,000-strong SLA helping them to patrol the 15-km (nine-miles)-deep zone in south Lebanon set up by the Jewish state to stop cross-border raids on northern Israel.
